sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You must give way to drivers coming from the right. A pedestrian is not a driver, so you do not have to give way to them. Because the pedestrian is crossing in front of you and is not following the same road, the rule 'traffic going straight ahead on the same road has priority over traffic turning off' does not apply either.

sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: You are being warned of a moveable bridge.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the car on the right?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a multi-lane roundabout. Overtaking on the right is allowed both directly before joining roundabouts and on roundabouts, so you may overtake the car.

sorular.soru: Should you expect mopeds, cyclists, and pedestrians here?

feedback.metin: On roads without an axis line, a speed limit of 80 km/h applies, or a reduced speed of 60 km/h if signs indicate this. These roads can be used by anyone, including drivers of agricultural vehicles, mopeds, snorfietsen, cyclists, and pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Must you use sidelights in combination with rear lights when parking here?
cevaplar: Yes. Both on the verge and the carriageway.
No. You do not have to use any lighting while parking.
Yes. But only when parking on the carriageway.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only when parking on the carriageway.

feedback.metin: Sidelights must be used in combination with rear lights when parking on a carriageway outside of built-up areas at night. This requirement does not apply to verges or within built-up areas on the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Can you hold a competition at the traffic lights with another driver to determine who can accelerate fastest?
cevaplar: Yes. Provided you stay within the speed limit.

feedback.metin: Holding or participating in races on public roads is prohibited. Speeding off at a traffic light with another driver to determine who is the fastest is also considered racing and is therefore prohibited even if you do not exceed the applicable speed limit.

sorular.soru: In which situation may the cyclist go first?

feedback.metin: In situation A you have to give priority to the cyclist because they come from the right. In situation B you can go first because you come from the right. You are on crossing roads, not on the same road. This means that the 'through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off' rule does not apply here.

sorular.soru: Should you wait here for the traffic light until there is enough space?

feedback.metin: You may only enter an intersection if you can clear it immediately. This is not the case here, as the intersection is full and the vehicles are braking. There is not yet enough space beyond the intersection. Only when this is the case may you continue, unless the traffic light is yellow or red again.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to reverse out of here?

feedback.metin: Turning, reversing and stopping is prohibited on autowegen and motorways.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to answer a phone call?

feedback.metin: Hard shoulders and lay-bys can only be used in emergency situations. Stopping to answer a phone call is not an emergency situation.

sorular.soru: How far in advance should you indicate if you want to exit a motorway?

feedback.metin: If you want to exit a motorway, you must indicate this well in advance. Approximately 300 metres before an exit, indicate right. This lets other drivers know what you are planning to do.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Keep your distance and wait until you can overtake on the left.
Drive closely behind the vehicle and use light signals.
Indicate right and overtake on the right.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep your distance and wait until you can overtake on the left.

feedback.metin: If you are driving behind a vehicle driving in the left lane for too long, you are not allowed to overtake on the right, nor are you allowed to use any light or sound signals. However inconvenient this may be, you must wait until the vehicle in front moves to the right and you can overtake on the left. Maintain sufficient following distance and do not tailgate.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: Loads may never fall off a trailer. In case of loose cargo, you must use a net to cover the cargo, so it cannot fall out of the trailer. You are therefore not allowed to drive like this.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a defective odometer?

feedback.metin: You can drive with a defective odometer. A defective speedometer is prohibited. An odometer and a speedometer are not the same. An odometer indicates the distance the vehicle has driven. A speedometer indicates the speed.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to pick up a passenger?

feedback.metin: Stopping voluntarily at an intersection, on a level crossing, cycle lane, a carriageway alongside a cycle lane or in a tunnel, are all prohibited. Stopping here to pick up a passenger is therefore not allowed.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the disembarking tram passengers?

feedback.metin: If you want to pass a stationary tram or bus on the right, and there is no exit platform next to the tram or bus, you must give way to disembarking passengers.

sorular.soru: Does a 2toDrive coach need to carry a driving licence?
cevaplar: No, valid identification will also suffice.
Yes, both the driver and the coach must be able to present a driving licence.
No, a coach does not need to carry anything.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, both the driver and the coach must be able to present a driving licence.

feedback.metin: Both the driver and the coach must be able to show the original and undamaged driving licence upon an inspection.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?
cevaplar: That depends on where you want to go after this intersection.
No. You need to be in the right lane.
Yes. This is the best lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: That depends on where you want to go after this intersection.

feedback.metin: If there is more than one lane on the left, you should generally use the right lane as much as possible. Possible good reasons not to do this include, for example, if you want to overtake or turn left again after this intersection. In this case, there is no other traffic, so overtaking is not applicable. It, therefore, depends on where you want to go after this intersection.

sorular.soru: Does an anti-lock braking system always ensure a shorter braking distance?

feedback.metin: An anti-lock braking system (ABS) ensures that the vehicle remains easier to steer during an emergency stop, but does not necessarily ensure a shorter braking distance. An anti-lock braking system prevents the tyres from locking during braking. When braking on a gravel road surface or a very wet or slippery road surface, the braking distance is usually longer with an anti-lock braking system.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You are reversing around a bend, which is a special manoeuvre. When executing a special manoeuvre, you must give way to all other traffic, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the tram like this?

feedback.metin: You may overtake a tram in the middle of a carriageway on the right.

sorular.soru: Your car has broken down. Is it safe to stay in the car while waiting for help?

feedback.metin: If you park on the hard shoulder due to a breakdown, it is advised to leave your car and wait for help behind the crash barrier. You should also wear a high-visibility vest.

sorular.soru: Is the headrest adjusted properly?

feedback.metin: The top of the headrest should be as high as the top of the driver's head. The headrest is set too high here.

sorular.soru: Is reverse lighting mandatory on a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of up to 750 kg?

feedback.metin: Reversing lights are not mandatory on a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of up to 750 kg. On heavier trailers, however, this reversing light must be fitted.

sorular.soru: Are you always required to give right of way to a driver of a disabled vehicle?

feedback.metin: You are not always required to give right of way to disabled vehicles. They do not fall under 'reduced mobility' because they use an aid. If they use the pavement or footpath or cross the road, the rules of pedestrians apply to them. If they use the cycle path or the carriageway, the rules of drivers apply to them.

sorular.soru: What should you do during an emergency stop when the brake pedal starts to vibrate in a vehicle with ABS?
cevaplar: Release the brake pedal briefly and then press it firmly again.
Keep the brake pedal fully depressed.
Release the brake pedal completely until it stops vibrating.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep the brake pedal fully depressed.

feedback.metin: During an emergency stop in a vehicle with ABS, you will notice that the brake pedal will vibrate if you press it hard. This has to do with the ABS acting on the brake force. This prevents the wheels from locking. If you release the brake pedal (briefly) at that moment, the vehicle will not continue to brake, and the braking distance will become longer. So keep on applying the brake until you stop.

sorular.soru: What are the risks of having a separate navigation system attached to the windscreen?
cevaplar: You may create an extra blind spot.
You may be more distracted than with a built-in system.
You may damage the windscreen when attaching the system.
sorular.dogruCevap: You may create an extra blind spot.

feedback.metin: Always be careful when attaching a navigation system to the front windscreen. Try to place these at the bottom or in the corner where possible. Although a small device, cyclists and sometimes even cars can be made invisible by the presence of a navigation system on the windscreen. These systems create an extra blind spot that you must take care to check. There is no danger of damaging the windscreen, as the devices are made for this purpose. Any risk of distraction is no greater than that posed by a built-in navigation system.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to go first?

feedback.metin: The cyclist is travelling straight ahead on the same road from where the passenger car wants to turn off of. Through traffic on the same road has right of way over traffic turning off.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?

feedback.metin: Here, you are approaching a level crossing without barriers, but with an automatic flashing light installation. When the top white light flashes, no train is approaching, and it is safe to cross. When a train is approaching, the two lower red lamps blink alternately.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: If the broken line is next to your half of the road, you may overtake. This means that oncoming vehicles are not allowed to overtake.

sorular.soru: Does stress affect driving ability?

feedback.metin: Driving when stressed is not recommended, as this has a negative effect on your driving style. In traffic, you often must decide and react in fractions of seconds. Stress, hurry, fatigue and lack of sleep can reduce your ability to react, perceive and concentrate. This increases the risk of an accident.

sorular.soru: The towing vehicle has a maximum authorised mass of 2800 kg. The maximum authorised mass of the trailer is 850 kg. Can you drive this combination with only a B driving licence?
cevaplar: No. You need a C driving licence.
No. You need a BE driving licence.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You need a BE driving licence.

feedback.metin: Driving licence category B applies to drivers of passenger cars with a maximum authorised mass of 3500 kg and a trailer with a maximum authorised mass not exceeding 750 kg. Heavier trailers may still be towed with driving licence B if the maximum authorised mass of the combination (car and trailer) does not exceed 3500 kg. In this case, the trailer is heavier than 750 kg and the combination heavier than 3500 kg. You are therefore not allowed to drive this combination with only a B driving licence. For this you need the BE driving licence. If the towing vehicle itself is already heavier than 3500 kg, a C driving licence is required. This is not the case at the moment.

sorular.soru: Are motorcyclists allowed to drive past slow-moving or stationary traffic jams on motorways?

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to pass slow-moving or stationary traffic jams by driving between the two left-most lanes with a speed difference of no more than 10 km/h. Making room for passing motorcyclists benefits all drivers, as fewer vehicles in line reduces traffic jams.

sorular.soru: Should you expect the snorfietser to ride on the carriageway?

feedback.metin: Snorfietsers must follow the rules that apply to cyclists. They must use the cycle path. The sign only directs moped and speed pedelec riders to the carriageway; they are not allowed to continue riding on the cycle path. So you do not have to expect that the snorfietser will enter the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Does using cruise control save energy?

feedback.metin: Cruise control regulates a constant speed, so you brake less and accelerate less. As a result, cruise control ensures lower energy consumption.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles are particularly susceptible to strong winds?
cevaplar: Motorcycles, lorries, and vehicles with a caravan.
Tractors, lorries, and vehicles with a trailer.
sorular.dogruCevap: Motorcycles, lorries, and vehicles with a caravan.

feedback.metin: Tall vehicles that catch a lot of wind are particularly susceptible to strong winds, especially when empty or carrying light loads. The most common reason lorries are overturned by strong winds is that they are empty. Two-wheeled vehicles, such as motorcycles, are also highly susceptible to strong winds.

sorular.soru: Is a skateboard a vehicle?

feedback.metin: A skateboard does not fall under the category of vehicles but is an object. That's why a person moving around on a skateboard does not fall under drivers but under pedestrians.

sorular.soru: When should a car running on gas be inspected for the first time?

feedback.metin: Cars running on diesel, gas, or hydrogen must be inspected for the first time after 3 years, and every year after that.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?

feedback.metin: You should always position yourself as far to the right as possible. To overtake the vehicle up ahead, you do not yet need to drive in the middle lane. You must, therefore, move one lane to the right.

sorular.soru: When is it obligated to use dipped headlights?
cevaplar: At night and during the day when visibility is poor.
Both during the day and at night.
sorular.dogruCevap: At night and during the day when visibility is poor.

feedback.metin: Dipped headlights must be used when driving at night. You must also use dipped headlights during the day when visibility is poor. Visibility may be impaired by, for example, a setting sun, twilight, rain, fog, snow, and driving in forests or tunnels.
